Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Perioperative Omega-3 Fatty Acid Supplementation in Colorectal Cancer Surgery

Participants.evidence: patients scheduled for elective colorectal cancer resection

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either an n-3 FA-enriched oral nutrition supplement (ONS) or a standard ONS (control)

Objective.evidence: aimed to evaluate the effect of perioperative omega-3 fatty acid (n-3 FA) supplementation on postoperative outcomes and survival

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was postoperative complications

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed

Blinding.evidence: Patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors were blinded

Number_Analysed.evidence: 125 were analysed (65 n-3 FA, 60 control) using an intention-to-treat approach

Result_Outcome.evidence: The 3-year disease recurrence risk was similar (RR 1.66, 95% CI 0.65 to 4.26)
